items.title: Google Asks Supreme Court to Intervene in Dispute With Fortnite Creator
items.summary: The case could rewrite the rules on how businesses make money on Google’s smartphone operating system.

items.title: Hegseth Is Said to Have Summoned U.S. Military Brass From Around the Globe
items.summary: The unusual directive, without a stated reason, came after the defense secretary has fired several top officers and ordered a reduction in four-star officers.

items.title: Sara Jane Moore, Would-Be Assassin of President Ford, Dies at 95
items.summary: A mother of four on the fringes of radical leftist movements, she fired at the president outside a San Francisco hotel in 1975. She had hoped to spark a revolution, she said.

items.title: Wyden Presses JPMorgan Chief Dimon for Answers on Jeffrey Epstein
items.summary: Senator Ron Wyden, Democrat of Oregon, sent a list of questions to Jamie Dimon, head of the country’s biggest bank, about its financial relationships with Mr. Epstein, the convicted sex offender.

items.title: Justice Dept. Official Pushes Prosecutors to Investigate George Soros’s Foundation
items.summary: The directive suggests department leaders are following orders from the president, a major break from decades of past practice meant to insulate the agency from political interference.

items.title: White House Threat of Federal Layoffs Only Deepens Shutdown Impasse
items.summary: Democratic leaders said the administration’s plan to fire government workers in the event of a shutdown would not prompt them to drop their demands in their spending standoff with the G.O.P.

items.title: Trump claims rise in political violence is ‘radical left causing this problem, not the right’ – US politics live
items.summary: <p>President again jumped to blame political opponents after three detainees were shot in attack on immigration facility </p><p><strong>Dozens of House <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/democrats">Democrats</a> have signed a letter to <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/donaldtrump">Donald Trump</a> and secretary of state <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/marco-rubio">Marco Rubio</a>, urging the administration to recognize Palestinian statehood.</strong></p><p>The letter, led by <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/california">California</a> Democrat Ro Khanna, has 46 signatures, and lawmakers will send it to the US president on Friday, <strong>according to plans first provided to the Guardian</strong>.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/sep/25/donald-trump-james-comey-fbi-ice-texas-latest-us-politics-news-updates-live">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: US authorities remove Trump-Epstein statue from National Mall
items.summary: <p>Interior department says National Park Service removed statue of pair holding hands because of incorrect permit</p><p>An <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/23/national-mall-trump-epstein-statue">impromptu statue</a> of Donald Trump and <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/jeffrey-epstein">Jeffrey Epstein</a> holding hands was unceremoniously removed from the National Mall in Washington just a day after a group of anonymous artists erected it there.</p><p>The piece showed the president and the late convicted sex offender, who were friends in the past, looking joyful together, with wide grins and feet kicked back.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/25/trump-epstein-statue-dc-removed">Continue reading...</a>
